page.title: 01Broadwater Bottom
page.content: Wholly agricultural, with exception of Farmington quarry (04130217) which produces Cotswold (Oolitic) Limestone building stone in blocks and also finished window mouldings etc. Crops are mostly wheat and barley and managed grassland but there are several substantial patches of (mainly) deciduous woodland. Lots of pheasants and hares and a few fallow deer roam about. High enough (140m to200m) to be cold and windy in winter Cotswold drystone walls divide the fields but many are falling down and are replaced with wire. Sheep and cattle to be seen on grassland in summer, indoors in winter mostly.
